moreDetails.title: Some more details...
moreDetails.details1:
Our insurance suite is designed as micro-service architecture, which allows an easy integration and replacement of single components. For example you have already a document management system and you are satisfied with it – use it! We will seamless integrate into z.Insurance-Suite.

For our development we use as often as possible industrial / market standards!
Please find below a short extract of our used technologies:
list: Java EE 7 with JPA, JAX-RS, EJB
BPMN2.0, DMN1.1
Keycloak
maven, Jenkins, Selenium, Sonar, Nexus3
Wildfly, Docker
Angular (we are just evaluating the next JavaScript standard ECMAScript 6/ES6)
Gulp, NPM, Karma
moreDetails.details2: We continuously update our technology stack to latest technologies that give us a benefit!

machineRoom.detailsTitle: What's happening in our machine room?
machineRoom.details:
Our micro-services provides only stateless services, which are accessible via an REST API. We use Docker containers to ship our modules that allows an easy deployment and gives you great scaling possibilities.

All our services have its own transaction save persistence stores. Based on the module this is an RDBMS like Oracle Database/Schema or a JSON store like MongoDB or Oracle 12g (with JSON support).

All services are orchestrated by a Business Process Management System (BPMS) based on BPMN2.0 standard. This is the starting point for customization. Inside the ICE (integrate-control-extend) component, you can extend or change our standard BPM processes that describes the business transactions of the system. Based on the BPM you have very smart possibilities to integrate existing systems from your IT landscape.

If you need completely new functionality that is not part of our standard solution or the standard behaviour of our system fits not to your need (sorry, but also these can happen time by time;-)), we/you will develop new services inside the ICE (integrate-control-extend) component or create completely new REST services from scratch that follows your requirements.
Our backend services are completely decoupled from our frontend services by an REST interface. The frontend is developed by a mobile first approach by using Angular and Bootstrap.

In sum, our technical design and architecture is inspired by Java Champions like Adam Bien or Arun Gupta.

cloudServices.title: Insurance Cloud Services
cloudServices.subtitle: Start your insurance business with tech11 cloud services.
cloudServices.abstract:
Use all our products direclty as cloud services! We are able to offer you a transaction based pricing starting by 1,39€ per insurance contract!

Perfect to scale your business!
cloudServices.details:
The cloud services offers a full P&C insurance suite with standarized interfaces for incoming and outcoming data like data for your financial sysmtes /SAP. Optional you are able to connect and integrate also your/extern public services like customer credit ranking.
From a technical point of view, our offering for cloud services brings you dedicated persistance storage / schemas.

Your services, your data, your virtual private cloud!

With the product engine you are able to configure and adapt your insurance products for the cloud. Furthermore, our container based architecture with the ICE module (integrate-control-extrand) allows you also your customized processes inside the cloud!

rating.name: rating
rating.claim: The most business friendly rating engine
rating.abstract: Define your tariff in MS Excel, import into s.Rating and done.

description.title: Speed up introduction of tariffs:
description.content1:
Based on our experience most business departments create their tariffs in Excel.
Next step they hand out the Excel-Tariff to their IT department that start to code or model the tariff in a complex tool.
After that, business department can start and compare if there are some errors inside the coded tariff and if the tariff works as the base Excel tariff.... and mostly start again the loop.
Get rid of this procedure. Use z.Rating!
list: Use your favourite tool Excel to build a tariff
Upload the tariff to z.Rating
Done
description.content2: Stay the owner of your tariff!

features.title: Features of z.Rating
list: Tariff design in MS Excel (calculation core)
Comfortable test possibilities (test suites)
Fast rating: a full contract version is tarriffed in one-roundtrip by providing premiums for each contract module
By linking to z.policy-administration forecast and if-then szenarios can be run
Version manamagement for tariffs
Separation between tariff version and calculation core
Possibility for easy linking to legay calculation cores for designated tariff versions

docs.name: docs
docs.abstract: Create, edit and store your documents as simple as possible!

description.title: Easy document management:
description.content1: Creating documents is often done by using complex document unit oriented systems. s.Docs use direclty MS Word as templating engine. Define an output format (e.g. docx or pdf) and give clerks the possibiltiy to edit and save documents on a web based enviornment in an comfortable way. A cloud based storage is directly supported.
list: Define templates in MS Word
Save modifications in a comfortable way
Save documents to your SAN or at AWS S3

features.title: Features of z.Docs
list: Document generation:
Template definition in MS Word
Variable placeholder, formatting (date, number), hide sections, loops, includes, images, bar codes
Suppoted output formats doc, docx, pdf, html among others
Edit documents:
Modify and save directly MS Word documents from your policy-administration or claims system directly without local download and upload
Storage:
Management of meta information
Use SAN as storage or cloud based storage like Amazon AWS S3

description.content1: With s.claims you have a tool to manage your claims in an easy way..
list: Notification of claim - claim - subclaims - damaged object / injured person
